arm_group.description: triptorelin 3.75 mg, im, monthly, three times

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether GnRH agonist treatment before cold loop
      hysteroscopic myomectomy is effective in reducing operative time, fuid absorption and
      difficulty of the procedure.

clinical_study.brief_title: GnRH Agonist Pretreatment in Hysteroscopic Myomectomy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  submucous myoma diagnosed by vaginal ultrasonography and confirmed by diagnostic
             hysteroscopy

          -  premenopausal status

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  present or past history of cancer

          -  pregnancy

          -  presence of associated multiple polyps

          -  presence of > 2 myomas

          -  associated nonhysteroscopic surgical procedures

clinical_study.official_title: Surgical Effects of GnRH Agonist Pretreatment on Cold Loop Hysteroscopic Myomectomy.

oversight_info.authority: Italy: National Monitoring Centre for Clinical Trials - Ministry of Health

primary_outcome.measure: Minutes (surgical procedure time), milliliters (fluid absorption during the procedure), 0-3 scale (difficulty of the procedure), 0-3 scale (quality of image)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minutes after the end of the surgical procedure.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Azienda Ospedaliera S. Maria della Misericordia

clinical_study.source: Azienda Ospedaliera S. Maria della Misericordia

lead_sponsor.agency: Azienda Ospedaliera S. Maria della Misericordia

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment
